newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens shares up before H1 1996/97 figures.
newsitem.headline: Siemens shares up before H1 1996/97 figures.

text.p: Shares in German electronics group Siemens AG advanced over two percent to 91.90 marks ($53.96) in bourse trade on Tuesday on positive expectations for the group's first-half 1996/97 half-year figures due Wednesday.
Siemens' shares comfortably outperformed the overall DAX index of German blue-chips, which was up 6.16 points, or 0.18 percent, at 3,353.74 points at 0903 GMT.

Dealers said there was "a good feeling in the market" about the impending figures, while others said that an announcement on Monday that the group wanted to sell its dental technology unit was also positively received.
Analysts were more cautious on the outlook for Siemens' first-half figures.
Klaus Repges at Trinkaus Capital Management said he thought that the net profits in the first half of 1996/97 would be 1.053 billion marks, below the previous year's figure of 1.083 billion marks.
He said he thought the sale of the dental technology unit was good for the company, which has been experiencing problems in its medical business.
